intro: Sabulina mesogitana subsp. lydia, commonly known as Lydia's sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to the Mediterranean region, this subspecies thrives in rocky and sandy soils, often found in coastal and mountainous areas. The plant typically blooms in spring, producing white or pale pink flowers that attract pollinators. Its unique adaptations to arid environments make it an important species in ecological studies of xerophytic vegetation.
